chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] cases #21CF180, #21CF297, #21CT588, #21CT603, #22CF87, #22CF137 called at 1:48pm.
Defendant Eric Nava appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (Attorney De La Rosa is PD-appointed counsel in these cases).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Arguments are given on bond. 
In case #22CF87 the Court requires that an additional $200 Cash Bond be posted.
In case #22CF137 the Court modifies the bond from a Signature Bond to now be a $300 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  
recess 1:54pm.

State moves for issues of a bond only bench warrant in each case and a finding that the bond in each case is in default; so ordered by the Court.

Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Cases 21CF180, 21CF297, 21CT588, 21CT603, and 22CF87 called at 3:51PM
Defendant Eric Nava in court with attorney John E. German. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att German advises that the Defendant cannot retain him on files 21CT588, 21CT603, and 22CF87. Att German advises that he has instructed the Defendant in regrads to the Public Defender's Office and the process for applying for a county appointed attorney.
Att German requests that a Status of Counsel be scheduled, as new counsel will likely be taking over all the files. The State has no objection.

The Court orders the Defendant to call the Public Defender's Office today before 4:00PM to apply for their services, as well as appear before Room 115 in the Jefferson County Courthouse to acquire, complete, and submit a Petition for a County Appointed Attorney.

Upon inquiry by the Defense, the Court informs Att German that he can appear by phone at the next scheduled hearing.

recess 4:01PM

NEXT: 
In all files:
Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 04/21 at 1:30PM
Copy of Letter from DA to Def re: 3/21/22 Appearance
Status conference on March 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver license

[ml] Case called at 1:14PM
Defendant Eric Nava appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def has not been eval'd).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 
Att De La Rosa advises that the Defendant has not been evaluated for the PD Office's services, and that the Defendant will attempt to retain Att German for these matters.

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
As the Defendant does not have counsel, the Court tolls any pending timelimits and preserves the Defendant's jurisdictional objections and sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel.

The Court requires a $300.00 Cash Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver license

recess 1:23PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 03/04 at 3:00PM
